replies.body: I remember that last time when you talked about riftwalk you mentioned that it was going to maybe be available in other parts of the country in the future. Any plans on making one in Florida? {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
How about in eastern tx? Or western Arkansas?

Oh my goodness, how about <place where I live or close to it>? That would be so cool.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
MISSOURI! Its in the middle of the us its perfect!

Hello fellow Missourian! I too wish to partake in the spoils of the riftwalk but sadly people i play with still find it hard to believe we even have internet capable of playing the game =/i think the closest we would get is Kansas City, Kansas

Another fellow Missourian with 21 ms ping (not sure why people think our net sucks).  St Louis has a large fan base and a recently vacated venue due to the Rams ditching us.  Lets replace that with some gaming ;)
I'd say Dallas has a pretty decent chance of getting picked, which isn't too far away from us East Texans
Orlando Florida has a MUCH greater chance of being picked. No body says "I'm going to retire and buy a condo in texas"
Sorry, I forgot that the majority of League players are retired and living in Florida
does this fit in with keeping Austin weird?
any in North Carolina?
What about Louisiana? We aren't just a bunch of redneck swamp people you know
Well, a fair portion of us are...
Being a cajun gamer is tough...
Louisiana here too, bud. And things do happen here.. sometimes. << >>
Yeah but then again nothings in north caronlina xD
Yeah, nothing except, ya know, both the mountains and the beach :P
Theres a huge fanbase in Salt Lake City, UT would be great place to hold LCS for western part of the US!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Yes PLEASE.
What about elsewhere in Canada? Maritimes maybe?

I'd say that there's a slim chance of a big LCS Event happening in somewhere like the Maritimes. Riot wants these big events to be in big cities, where they can attract the most fans. Not saying that it will never happen, but it's not likely.

why would they host it in the Maritimes 3/4 of the population down here is like a century old and the other half is too busy out smokin darts an brapin around 

if we got lucky they might do it in quebec thats only a 4-5 max hour drive from most places in the maritimes... then again who wants to go to quebec lmao rip
when you're banished from Canada {{item:3151}}
When you're banished from the United States{{item:3151}}
When your making plans to move to Canada if Trump becomes president {{item:3151}}
